titleInfo.title: 'General View from R.I.M.S. Hardinge,Maskat.' Photographer: Unknown

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:206 x 283 mmCondition:The print is in good condition, though the mounting paper is heavily foxed and crumbling.Foliation:‘3’Process:Silver gelatin

mods.abstract: Genre/Subject Matter:View of Muscat from on board R.I.M.S. Hardinge. This photograph was likely taken on or around 18 November 1903, the day that the fleet of ships participating in Lord Curzon’s tour of the Persian Gulf arrived at Muscat.Fort Al Jalali is visible along the horizon immediately left of centre. From the fort the harbour extends to the right, with the British Agency visible at centre – a flagstaff denotes its location. The Sultan’s palace is probably the large white complex of buildings at left. Two steamers – directly in front of the fort and at right – are anchored in the harbour.Inscriptions:Ink, below image: 'General View from R.I.M.S. Hardinge, Maskat.'
